alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 7:16PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN SANDOVAL AND NORTHWESTERN SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 715 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Kewa Pueblo to near La Cienega. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Santa Fe, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Santo Domingo Pueblo, San Felipe Pueblo, La Cienega, Kewa Pueblo, Cochiti Pueblo, La Bajada, Cochiti Lake and Domingo. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 252 and 279. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Santa Fe Metro Area
